quizzes.title: History Quiz: Students and School
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, similarities, report. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: At 11:10 on Tuesday April 20, 1999, two students entered Columbine High School and in about 48 minutes massacred twelve students and a teacher.  Who are the two students responsible for one of the deadliest school shooting in the history of the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harris and Klebold

questions.question: The term Trenchcoat Mafia is associated with which school shooting?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Columbine High School

questions.question: Marc Lepina, a student of the Ecole Polytechnique in Quebec, Canada shot and murdered fourteen people on December 6, 1989. What group of people did Marc Lepina stalk and kill that day?
In May 2002 the Secret Service published a report about similarities in school shootings. What was NOT one of the findings of the report?

options.text: That most attackers had access to weapons.
That attackers violence was sudden and  impulsive.
Before the attack, others were aware of the planned attack.
Most attackers felt bullied or persecuted.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: That attackers violence was sudden and  impulsive.

questions.question: This is the Greek name of a city located about 40km from Beirut, Lebanon.
What was the name of the student and former marine who shot and killed fourteen people from the tower of the main building of the University of Texas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles Whitman

questions.question: In Back to the Future 2, Doc electronically hypnotized Jennifer.
Charles Carl Roberts entered a schoolhouse in Nickel Mines and shot ten students and teachers, killing five. To what peaceful religious group did the victims belong?

Michael Moore won an Academy Award for Best Documentary Feature for his film about the Columbine High School massacre. What activity that both shooters took part in did Michael Moore incorporate in the title of his film?
What is the name of Marty and Jennifers daughter in the movie Back to the Future 2?

On April 3, 1962 sixteen-year-old Brenda Ann Spencer fired on the Cleveland Elementary School in San Diego killing the principal and school custodian and wounding eight children. What was the reason Brenda Ann Spencer gave the police when she was asked to explain her motives?

options.text: Somebody had to shut those monkeys up!
Those brats have called me names for the last time.
I had to get some sleep. The kids just kept screaming and yelling.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I dont like Mondays.

questions.question: The Virginia Tech Massacre is the deadliest school massacre is the history of the United States.

The opening day of school in the town of Baslan, a part of the Russian Federation, turned into a day of horror for the small village. Terrorists held the children and parents hostages for three days until a bloody gun battle between the terrorists and the Russian security forces ended in a bloodbath that shocked the world. Who were the terrorists that caused the death of at least 386 people, 186 of the dead being children?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chechen Separatist

questions.question: In the 1989 movie Back to the Future Part II, Slamball was mentioned in a scene taking place in 2015. In what year was the sport Slamball actually created?
This city, located north of the Dead Sea, is the lowest permanently inhabited site in the world.

quizzes.title: History Quiz: City and Iraq
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, iraq, strauss. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Joseph Strauss was chief engineer of this famous bridge, completed in 1937.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Golden Gate Bridge

questions.question: Big Bens 150th anniversary was in May 2009.
What is the length of the entire Great Wall, with all of its branches?
What year was the Eiffel Tower constructed?
Jerusalem is a holy city of which of these major religions?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Erbil Citadel is an ancient fortress in Iraq.
In the centre of this city in Syria there is an ancient castle known as Citadel.
Beirut was conquered by Agrippa, a Roman statesman and general.
What European city was named Philippopolis or the city of Philip?
The ancient city of Tyre, located in present-day Lebanon, is the birthplace of the mythological figure, named Europa.
The ancient city of Susa was conquered by Alexander the Great.
Why was the Taj Mahal built by Mughal emperor Shah Jahan?

options.text: It was built in memory of his wife, Mumtaz Mahal
It was built as a palace for the emperor.
It was built as a temple for the alter of eternal sanctity.
It was built as an amusement park attraction.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It was built in memory of his wife, Mumtaz Mahal

questions.question: This wall, sometimes called the Wailing Wall, is one of the most sacred sites in Judaism.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Western Wall

questions.question: Who built the Statue of Liberty, which was a gift from France to the US?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Auguste Bartholdi

questions.question: Which Turkish city is a probable site of the Hellenistic city of Antiochia ad Taurum?

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Buzz and Toy Story
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, colosseum, key. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which Chinese character is used in Chinese New Year decorations and is often placed upside-down on the front door of a house?

options.text: Fu - Blessing, Good Fortune, Good Luck

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fu - Blessing, Good Fortune, Good Luck

questions.question: What is the most widely recognized international symbol of pharmacy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The bowl of Hygeia

questions.question: In the Toy Story movies, Buzz doesnt like Jessie.
The construction of the Colosseum of Rome was started under Emperor Nero.
The wedding ceremony of Charles, Prince of Wales and Lady Diana Spencer took place at this famous landmark, which is also the seat of the Bishop of London.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St Pauls Cathedral

questions.question: At the beginning of Toy Story 3, Andy is 17 and packing for college. What does he intend to do with his toys?

options.text: give them to the kid next door
donate them to the Sunnyside Daycare

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: none of these

questions.question: What does Sid (the kid next door) do to Buzz in the movie Toy Story?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ties him to a rocket

questions.question: What symbol, also known as the key of the Nile, appears frequently in Egyptian tomb paintings?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Ankh

questions.question: Who did Barbie fall in love with in Toy Story 3?
How many fingers do the three little aliens have on one hand in the movie Toy Story?
The Celtic spiral knot stands for growth, eternal life and movement.
The cobra is an emblem associated with the king, and kingdom of Lower Egypt.
At the beginning of Toy Story, Buzz believes that he is a real space ranger.
Which of these is an eight-spoked cross symbolizing the eight day interval between Christ’s entry into Jerusalem and his resurrection?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Baptismal Cross

questions.question: Porky is the name of the Piggy Bank in Toy Story.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Words and Time
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, title, soul. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Im going away tonight. were the last words of this great American soul singer. I guess he couldnt say I feel good at the  time, but I knew that he  would.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Brown

questions.question: He was one of the most important scientists of all time and Beagle was important to his career even if he never had a dog. His last words were I am not the least afraid to die.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles Darwin

questions.question: Which of these is a symbol of Ireland and a trademark registered by the Government of Ireland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: I still live ...Poetry were the final words of this great orator from New England.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Daniel Webster

questions.question: Dont let it end like this. Tell them I said something. were the last words of this man. I guess if you are a revolutionary and have the US Army after you, you may not have a great quote at your death.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pancho Villa

questions.question: He was a painter, a war correspondent, a cigar smoker, and the leader of his country during some very tough times. His last words were: Im bored with it all.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Winston Churchill

questions.question: His name has become a movie title. His last words were Shoot straight, you bastards! Dont make a mess of it.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henry H. Morant

questions.question: Although he was a trained doctor, he gained his fame as a revolutionary. He was famous for riding motorcycles. His final words were I know you have  come to kill me. Shoot coward. You are only going to kill a man.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ernesto Guevara

questions.question: Although he was not in his Blue Period, this painters last words were: Drink to me!
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pablo Picasso

questions.question: He was the only US President to serve two non-consecutive terms. His last words were I have tried so hard  to do the right.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grover Cleveland

questions.question: Her last words were: My G-D. Whats happened?. The entire world mourned her tragic death. The people that watched her funeral were probably more than those who watched her beautiful wedding.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Diana Spencer

questions.question: What did the two goldfish originally represent in Hinduism?

options.text: the two main sacred rivers of India - the Ganges and Yamuna
protection from suffering and harmful forces

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the two main sacred rivers of India - the Ganges and Yamuna

questions.question: What popular symbol represents opposites that could only exist in relation to each other?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yin and yang

questions.question: What is the question? were the last words of this poetess.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gertrude Stein

questions.question: Which of the following is not a Hindu symbol?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Claddagh

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Password and Movie
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, fiction, stars. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What black comedy-crime film stars Frances McDormand as a pregnant police chief who investigates a series of homicides?

This romantic musical film, which featured the songs Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas and The Boy Next Door, is set at the time of the Louisiana Purchase Exposition.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Meet Me in St. Louis

questions.question: The clue words are Mammal, Gnu, Middle and Dutch. Guess the password.
His last words were not I cut down the cherry tree but It is well. I die hard, but I am not afraid to go.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Washington

questions.question: What European director created the 1984 movie Paris, Texas which was named after a US city of the same name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wim Wenders

questions.question: What movie is NOT correctly matched with the actors who star in it?

options.text: Gangs of New York - Leonardo DiCaprio, Cameron Diaz
From Paris with Love - John Travolta, Melissa Mars
Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas - Johnny Depp, Benicio del Toro

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Philadelphia - John Cusack, Morgan Freeman

questions.question: The clue words are Trip, Family, Christmas and European. Can you guess the password?
The clue words are Large, Stone, Architecture and Sculpture. Guess the password.
The clue words are Diaphragm, Mind and Nerve. Guess the password.

In the classic romantic drama Casablanca, German Major Strasser leads a group of officers in singing Die Wacht am Rhein and in response, Victor Laszlo orders the house band to play the French national anthem. Which French city gives its name to the French National anthem?

options.text: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas

questions.question: The clue words are Vapor, Disappear, Fade and Vanish. Guess the password.
What comedy-drama movie, starring Mia Farrow and Jeff Daniels, tells the story of a fictional character who leaves a movie and enters the real world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Purple Rose of Cairo

questions.question: This actress, who passed away in February, 2011, co-starred with Marlon Brando in the romantic drama film Last Tango in Paris.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maria Schneider

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: God Pan

The Egyptian god Horus was associated with which of the following animals?

According to Roman tradition the future founders of Rome were saved by a wolf.
